summary: Lawrence J. Delsa is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) during its investigation. He appears in payroll certifications for October and November 1977, as well as November 1978. The documents list his name, position, and salary, indicating his role within the committee's staff. The specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll suggests he contributed to the HSCA's efforts during the period.
significance: Lawrence J. Delsa's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his exact duties, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's work during the late 1970s.
